pli-tv-kd14:4.4.34: See Kd 18:1.2.22 for the correct interpretation of idaṁ saṅghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṁ, imaṁ kālaṁ pavisitabbaṁ, imaṁ kālaṁ nikkhamitabbanti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.11.2: Sānuvādo. Vin-vn-ṭ.2777: Sānuvādoti ettha anuvādo nāma codanā, saha anuvādena vattatīti sānuvādo, “Sānuvādo: here accusing is called anuvādo. Sānuvādo means he proceeds with an accusation.”
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.1: Cittavipariyāsakata, lit. “(his) mind was made distorted”.
pli-tv-kd14:10.1.3: The Pali just says “he knows”, jānāti, but it seems implied that this refers to the manager. Sp.4.204: Jānātīti salākaṁ gāhento jānāti “adhammavādī bahutarā”ti, “‘He knows’: the one distributing the voting tickets (i.e. the manager) knows that those speaking contrary to the Teaching are in the majority.”
pli-tv-kd14:13.3.1: I here follow the PTS reading, ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, as opposed to the Mahāsaṅgīti reading, athāparesaṁ ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ. With the Mahāsaṅgīti reading there is no distinction between the two groups of monks.
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.1: Bhikkhunīnaṁ anupakhajja, lit. “intruding on the nuns”. Sp.4.215: Bhikkhunīnaṁ anupakhajjāti bhikkhunīnaṁ anto pavisitvā, “Intruding on the nuns means having entered among the nuns.” The contextual point is that he is siding with the nuns.
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.1: According to the sub-commentary, this should be understood as a question. Sp-ṭ.3.220: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kusalaṃ akusalaṃ abyākatanti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃ kusalaṃ akusalaṃ udāhu abyākatanti pucchati. Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ siyā kusalantiādi vissajjanaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi, “Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kusalaṃ akusalaṃ abyākatan: he asks, ‘Is a legal issue arising from a dispute wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?’ ‘A legal issue arising from a dispute may be wholesome,’ etc., is the response. This method also applies to the rest (below).”
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.8: The Pali word āpatti means both “attainment” and “offense”.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.5: Gahitāgahitañca jāneyya, lit. “He should know taken and not taken.” The taking refers to the taking of voting tickets, salāka.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.27: I here follow the PTS reading, ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, as opposed to the Mahāsaṅgīti reading, athāparesaṁ ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ. With the Mahāsaṅgīti reading there is no distinction between the two groups of monks.
